author: lgray
body:
This is a PR so that I can make sure this migration remains technical (through jenkins tests), to mark progress, and to serve as a warning for the coming change. 
Please do not merge this, it is not ready.

This PR a checkpoint and is the first step in removing boost::spirit (through ExpressionParser and various other things) from CMSSW.

StringCutObjectParser now does not use reco::parser, but instead reco::ExpressionEvaluator from @VinInn.
All string cuts passed to the parser are now required to be valid C++, I wrote a simple customize for the HLT to deal with this. Elsewhere I have changed the strings by hand.

Right now this switch results in very slow CMSSW run times, due to invoking the compiler.
No memory improvements seen yet since boost::spirit (and resulting calls to TCling) still hangs around in memory.

Also, this breaks igprof as it exists right now.
title: Remove boost spirit from StringCutObjectParser
